greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = A003961(1+a(A064989(2n-1))), a(2n+1) = 1+A003961(a(A064989(2n+1)-1)).
comment: After 1, maps each even number to a unique odd number and vice versa, i.e., for all n > 1, A000035(a(n)) XOR A000035(n) = 1, where XOR is given in A003987.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ This function from _Michel Marcus_
A064989(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, if((2 == f[i,1]),f[i,1] = 1,f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1))); factorback(f);
(Scheme, with _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library for memoizing definec-macro)
xref: Similar entanglement permutations: A245605-A245606, A235491, A236854, A243347, A244152.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 18 2014; description corrected and PARI code added Jul 30 2014
